newsitem.title: USA: Macy's to phase out electronics businesses.
newsitem.headline: Macy's to phase out electronics businesses.

text.p: In a move toward a greater focus on its core fashion business, department store operator Macy's will phase out its electronics departments in coming months, the retailer said Tuesday.
Macy's said elimination of its electronics business will allow the company to allocate space to apparel and home categories.

"The very high-tech and rapidly changing electronics field -- TVs, VCRs, stereos, CD players, PCs and similar items -- involve major investment in dollars, management time and other resources that were out of proportion as contributors to Macy's major mission," said Hal Kahn, chairman of Macy's East.
No other departments are involved, Macy's said.
All employees affected by the phase-out in 65 stores will be offered other positions within their stores or a severance package.
Growth areas will include women's ready to wear, men's apparel and home furnishings.
Macy's is a division of Cincinnati-based Federated Department Stores Inc.
